arts.ttl: Real Madrid 4-1 Espanyol: Player ratings as Vinicius inspires comeback victory
arts.sum: Thibaut Courtois' unfortunate own goal early in the second half put the pressure on, but Madrid responded by bringing Vinicius off the bench and were celebrating Dani Carvajal's equaliser just moments later. Rodrygo tapped home a second with 15 minutes to go, before Vinicius grabbed his deserved goal to put the game to bed, and there was still time for a late Kylian Mbappe penalty to send the fans home happy.

arts.ttl: Real Madrid 4-1 Espanyol: Highlights, man of the match, stats
arts.sum: Vinicius Junior and Kylian Mbappe grab a goal apiece to help Real Madrid fight back from a goal down to beat Espanyol 4-1 at the Santiago Bernabeu.

arts.ttl: Super sub Vinícius sets up one and scores another as Real Madrid beats Espanyol
arts.sum: Espanyol goalkeeper Joan García made several saves including of shots by Kylian Mbappé before the Olympic gold medalist started an attack with a long pass from his box that ended with an own goal by counterpart Thibaut Courtois in the 54th minute. Vinícius beat García in the 78th for his goal after Espanyol lost the ball and Mbappé played his attack partner clear on the break.

arts.ttl: Vinícius > Mbappé: Real Madrid’s true star proves himself once more vs Espanyol
